User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12

I can draw on the bottom one pixel of the window frame when FF is maximized.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set XP start menu to the left and auto-hide.
2. Maximize FF (not fullscreen just maximized).
3. Click on FF to bring forward.
4. Go with the mouse to the left to show start menu, then let it auto-hide.

Actual Results:  
There is an imprint of the start menu on the window frame, on the area outside of the web page.

Expected Results:  
The frame should be as before the start menu overlapped it.

This can be done with moving any app (eg. Notepad) over the border.
The drawn image stays there after even ALT-TAB, only window resizing erases it.
It affects all tabs, and all new tabs.
The theme is the default theme.
